text: The Premios Sur Award for Best Actress (), is an award given annually by the Argentine Academy of Cinematography Arts and Sciences to the best actress in Argentina for that year. The award was suspended in 1955 with the military coup d'état known as the Revolución Libertadora and not revived until 2006, after the present Academy was founded in 2004. {| class="wikitable" style=" margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto" !style="background: #ccccff"|Year !style="background: #ccccff"|Actress !style="background: #ccccff"|Film |- |2017 |Sofía Gala Castiglione |Alanis |- |2016 |Natalia Oreiro |Gilda, no me arrepiento de este amor |- |- |2015 |Dolores Fonzi |La patota |- |2014 |Erica Rivas |Relatos salvajes |- |2013 |Julieta Díaz |Corazón de León |- |2012 |Natalia Oreiro |Infancia clandestina |- |2011 |Moro Anghileri |Aballay |- |2010 |Erica Rivas |Por tu culpa |- |2009 |Soledad Villamil |El secreto de sus ojos |- |2008 |Valeria Bertuccelli |Un novio para mi mujer |- |2007 |Carolina Peleritti |¿Quién dice que es fácil? |- |2006 |Graciela Borges |Las manos |- |1954-2005 |defunct | |- |1953 |Zully Moreno |La mujer de las camelias |- |1952 |Mirtha Legrand |La de los ojos color del tiempo |- |1951 |Tita Merello |Los isleros |- |1950 |Tita Merello |Arrabalera |- |1949 |Amelia Bence |Danza del fuego |- |1948 |no Best Actress given | |- |1947 |Amelia Bence |A sangre fría |- |1946 |Zully Moreno |Celos |- |1945 |Delia Garcés |La Dama duende |- |1944 |Mirtha Legrand |La pequeña señora de Pérez |- |1943 |Amelia Bence |Todo un hombre |- |1942 |Delia Garcés |Malambo |- |1941 |Delia Garcés |Veinte años y una noche |- |} ==References== Category:Argentine film awards Category:Cinema of Argentina Category:Latin American cinema Category:Film award stubs
